intro: Gnaphalium argyrocoma, commonly known as silverleaf cottonweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces fluffy, white to pale yellow flower heads that resemble cotton, which are composed of numerous tiny florets. Its leaves are typically silver-gray in color, covered in fine hairs that give it a distinctive appearance. Gnaphalium argyrocoma is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
